gc.mem_alloc.description: (function name) Get the number of bytes of heap RAM that are allocated.

gc.mem_alloc.summary.description: Get the number of bytes of heap RAM that are allocated.

gc.mem_free.description: (function name) Get the number of bytes of available heap RAM, or -1 if this amount is not known.

gc.mem_free.summary.description: Get the number of bytes of available heap RAM, or -1 if this amount is not known.

gc.threshold-1.description: (function name) Query the additional GC allocation threshold.

gc.threshold-1.summary.description: Query the additional GC allocation threshold.

gc.threshold-2.description: (function name) Set the additional GC allocation threshold.

gc.threshold-2.summary.description: Set the additional GC allocation threshold.

gc.threshold-2.param-name.amount.description: (parameter name) The number of bytes after which a garbage collection should be triggered.

log.description: (module name) Log data to your micro:bit V2.

log.summary.description: Log data to your micro:bit V2.

log.set_labels.description: (function name) Set up the log file header.

log.set_labels.summary.description: Set up the log file header.

log.set_labels.param-name.*labels.description: (parameter name) Any number of positional arguments, each corresponding to an entry in the log header.

log.set_labels.param-name.timestamp.description: (parameter name) Select the timestamp unit that will be automatically added as the first column in every row. Timestamp values can be one of ``log.MILLISECONDS``, ``log.SECONDS``, ``log.MINUTES``, ``log.HOURS``, ``log.DAYS`` or ``None`` to disable the timestamp. The default value is ``log.SECONDS``.

log.add-1.description: (function name) Add a data row to the log by passing a dictionary of headers and values.

log.add-1.summary.description: Add a data row to the log by passing a dictionary of headers and values.

log.add-1.param-name.data_dictionary.description: (parameter name) The data to log as a dictionary with a key for each header.

log.add-2.description: (function name) Add a data row to the log using keyword arguments.

log.add-2.summary.description: Add a data row to the log using keyword arguments.

log.delete.description: (function name) Deletes the contents of the log, including headers.

log.delete.summary.description: Deletes the contents of the log, including headers.

log.delete.param-name.full.description: (parameter name) ``True`` selects a “full” erase and ``False`` selects the “fast” erase method.

log.set_mirroring.description: (function name) Configure mirroring of the data logging activity to the serial output.

log.set_mirroring.summary.description: Configure mirroring of the data logging activity to the serial output.

log.set_mirroring.param-name.serial.description: (parameter name) ``True`` enables mirroring data to the serial output.

Output a PWM signal on the pin, with the duty cycle proportional to ``value``.
(parameter name) An integer or a floating point number between 0 (0% duty cycle) and 1023 (100% duty).

microbit.MicroBitDigitalPin.set_analog_p.description: (function name) Set the period of the PWM signal being output to ``period`` in milliseconds.
Set the period of the PWM signal being output to ``period`` in milliseconds.
(parameter name) The period in milliseconds with a minimum valid value of 1ms.
(function name) Set the period of the PWM signal being output to ``period`` in microseconds.
Set the period of the PWM signal being output to ``period`` in microseconds.
(parameter name) The period in microseconds with a minimum valid value of 256µs.

microbit.accelerometer.get_x.description: (function name) Get the acceleration measurement in the ``x`` axis in milli-g.

microbit.accelerometer.get_x.summary.description: Get the acceleration measurement in the ``x`` axis in milli-g.

microbit.accelerometer.get_y.description: (function name) Get the acceleration measurement in the ``y`` axis in milli-g.

microbit.accelerometer.get_y.summary.description: Get the acceleration measurement in the ``y`` axis in milli-g.

microbit.accelerometer.get_z.summary.description: Get the acceleration measurement in the ``z`` axis in milli-g.

microbit.accelerometer.get_values.description: (function name) Get the acceleration measurements in all axes at once as a tuple.

microbit.accelerometer.get_values.summar.description: Get the acceleration measurements in all axes at once as a tuple.

microbit.accelerometer.get_strength.description: (function name) Get the acceleration measurement of all axes combined, as a positive integer. This is the Pythagorean sum of the X, Y and Z axes.

microbit.accelerometer.get_strength.summ.description: Get the acceleration measurement of all axes combined, as a positive integer. This is the Pythagorean sum of the X, Y and Z axes.

microbit.accelerometer.current_gesture.description: (function name) Get the name of the current gesture.

microbit.accelerometer.current_gesture.s.description: Get the name of the current gesture.

microbit.accelerometer.is_gesture.description: (function name) Check if the named gesture is currently active.

microbit.accelerometer.is_gesture.summar.description: Check if the named gesture is currently active.

microbit.accelerometer.was_gesture.description: (function name) Check if the named gesture was active since the last call.

microbit.accelerometer.was_gesture.summa.description: Check if the named gesture was active since the last call.

microbit.accelerometer.get_gestures.description: (function name) Return a tuple of the gesture history.

microbit.accelerometer.get_gestures.summ.description: Return a tuple of the gesture history.

microbit.accelerometer.set_range.description: (function name) Set the accelerometer sensitivity range, in g (standard gravity), to the closest values supported by the hardware, so it rounds to either ``2``, ``4``, or ``8`` g.

microbit.accelerometer.set_range.param-n.description: (parameter name) New range for the accelerometer, an integer in ``g``.

microbit.audio.description: (module name) Play sounds using the micro:bit (import ``audio`` for V1 compatibility).

microbit.audio.summary.description: Play sounds using the micro:bit (import ``audio`` for V1 compatibility).

microbit.audio.play.description: (function name) Play a built-in sound, sound effect or custom audio frames.

microbit.audio.play.summary.description: Play a built-in sound, sound effect or custom audio frames.

microbit.audio.play.param-name.pin.description: (parameter name) An optional argument to specify the output pin can be used to  override the default of ``pin0``. If we do not want any sound to play we can use ``pin=None``.

microbit.audio.play.param-name.return_pi.description: (parameter name) Specifies a differential edge connector pin to connect to an external speaker instead of ground. This is ignored for the **V2** revision.

microbit.audio.play.param-name.source.description: (parameter name) A built-in ``Sound`` such as ``Sound.GIGGLE``, a ``SoundEffect`` or sample data as an iterable of ``AudioFrame`` objects.

microbit.audio.play.param-name.wait.description: (parameter name) If ``wait`` is ``True``, this function will block until the sound is complete.

microbit.audio.is_playing.description: (function name) Check whether a sound is playing.

microbit.audio.is_playing.summary.description: Check whether a sound is playing.

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.description: (class name) A sound effect, composed by a set of parameters configured via the constructor or attributes.

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.summary.description: A sound effect, composed by a set of parameters configured via the constructor or attributes.

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.WAVEFORM_SINE.description: (field name) Sine wave option used for the ``waveform`` parameter.
Sine wave option used for the ``waveform`` parameter.

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.WAVEFORM_SAWT.description: (field name) Sawtooth wave option used for the ``waveform`` parameter.
Sawtooth wave option used for the ``waveform`` parameter.

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.WAVEFORM_TRIA.description: (field name) Triangle wave option used for the ``waveform`` parameter.
Triangle wave option used for the ``waveform`` parameter.

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.WAVEFORM_SQUA.description: (field name) Square wave option used for the ``waveform`` parameter.
Square wave option used for the ``waveform`` parameter.

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.WAVEFORM_NOIS.description: (field name) Noise option used for the ``waveform`` parameter.
Noise option used for the ``waveform`` parameter.

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.SHAPE_LINEAR.description: (field name) Linear interpolation option used for the ``shape`` parameter.

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.SHAPE_LINEAR..description: Linear interpolation option used for the ``shape`` parameter.

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.SHAPE_CURVE.description: (field name) Curve interpolation option used for the ``shape`` parameter.

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.SHAPE_CURVE.s.description: Curve interpolation option used for the ``shape`` parameter.

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.SHAPE_LOG.description: (field name) Logarithmic interpolation option used for the ``shape`` parameter.

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.SHAPE_LOG.sum.description: Logarithmic interpolation option used for the ``shape`` parameter.

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.FX_NONE.description: (field name) No effect option used for the ``fx`` parameter.

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.FX_NONE.summa.description: No effect option used for the ``fx`` parameter.

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.FX_TREMOLO.description: (field name) Tremolo effect option used for the ``fx`` parameter.

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.FX_TREMOLO.su.description: Tremolo effect option used for the ``fx`` parameter.

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.FX_VIBRATO.description: (field name) Vibrato effect option used for the ``fx`` parameter.

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.FX_VIBRATO.su.description: Vibrato effect option used for the ``fx`` parameter.

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.FX_WARBLE.description: (field name) Warble effect option used for the ``fx`` parameter.

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.FX_WARBLE.sum.description: Warble effect option used for the ``fx`` parameter.

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.freq_start.description: (field name) Start frequency in Hertz (Hz), a number between ``0`` and ``9999``

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.freq_start.su.description: Start frequency in Hertz (Hz), a number between ``0`` and ``9999``

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.freq_end.description: (field name) End frequency in Hertz (Hz), a number between ``0`` and ``9999``

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.freq_end.summ.description: End frequency in Hertz (Hz), a number between ``0`` and ``9999``

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.duration.description: (field name) Duration of the sound in milliseconds, a number between ``0`` and ``9999``

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.duration.summ.description: Duration of the sound in milliseconds, a number between ``0`` and ``9999``

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.vol_start.description: (field name) Start volume value, a number between ``0`` and ``255``

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.vol_start.sum.description: Start volume value, a number between ``0`` and ``255``

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.vol_end.description: (field name) End volume value, a number between ``0`` and ``255``

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.vol_end.summa.description: End volume value, a number between ``0`` and ``255``

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.waveform.description: (field name) Type of waveform shape, one of these values: ``WAVEFORM_SINE``, ``WAVEFORM_SAWTOOTH``, ``WAVEFORM_TRIANGLE``, ``WAVEFORM_SQUARE``, ``WAVEFORM_NOISE`` (randomly generated noise)

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.waveform.summ.description: Type of waveform shape, one of these values: ``WAVEFORM_SINE``, ``WAVEFORM_SAWTOOTH``, ``WAVEFORM_TRIANGLE``, ``WAVEFORM_SQUARE``, ``WAVEFORM_NOISE`` (randomly generated noise)

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.fx.description: (field name) Effect to add on the sound, one of the following values: ``FX_TREMOLO``, ``FX_VIBRATO``, ``FX_WARBLE``, or ``FX_NONE``

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.fx.summary.description: Effect to add on the sound, one of the following values: ``FX_TREMOLO``, ``FX_VIBRATO``, ``FX_WARBLE``, or ``FX_NONE``

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.shape.description: (field name) The type of the interpolation curve between the start and end frequencies, different wave shapes have different rates of change in frequency. One of the following values: ``SHAPE_LINEAR``, ``SHAPE_CURVE``, ``SHAPE_LOG``

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.shape.summary.description: The type of the interpolation curve between the start and end frequencies, different wave shapes have different rates of change in frequency. One of the following values: ``SHAPE_LINEAR``, ``SHAPE_CURVE``, ``SHAPE_LOG``

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.__init__.description: (function name) Create a new sound effect.

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.__init__.para.description: (parameter name) Duration of the sound in milliseconds, a number between ``0`` and ``9999``.
(parameter name) End frequency in Hertz (Hz), a number between ``0`` and ``9999``.
(parameter name) Start frequency in Hertz (Hz), a number between ``0`` and ``9999``.
(parameter name) Effect to add on the sound, one of the following values: ``FX_TREMOLO``, ``FX_VIBRATO``, ``FX_WARBLE``, or ``FX_NONE``.

(parameter name) The type of the interpolation curve between the start and end frequencies, different wave shapes have different rates of change in frequency. One of the following values: ``SHAPE_LINEAR``, ``SHAPE_CURVE``, ``SHAPE_LOG``.
(parameter name) End volume value, a number between ``0`` and ``255``.
(parameter name) Start volume value, a number between ``0`` and ``255``.
(parameter name) Type of waveform shape, one of these values: ``WAVEFORM_SINE``, ``WAVEFORM_SAWTOOTH``, ``WAVEFORM_TRIANGLE``, ``WAVEFORM_SQUARE``, ``WAVEFORM_NOISE`` (randomly generated noise).

microbit.audio.SoundEffect.copy.description: (function name) Create a copy of this ``SoundEffect``.

(whole number between 0 and 255).

An ``AudioFrame`` object is a list of 32 samples each of which is a unsigned byte
(whole number between 0 and 255).

microbit.audio.AudioFrame.copyfrom.param.description: (parameter name) ``AudioFrame`` instance from which to copy the data.

microbit.compass.is_calibrated.description: (function name) Check is the compass is calibrated.

microbit.compass.clear_calibration.summa.description: Undoes the calibration, making the compass uncalibrated again.

microbit.compass.get_x.description: (function name) Get the magnetic field strength on the ``x`` axis.

microbit.compass.get_y.description: (function name) Get the magnetic field strength on the ``y`` axis.

microbit.compass.get_y.summary.description: Get the magnetic field strength on the ``y`` axis.

microbit.compass.get_z.description: (function name) Get the magnetic field strength on the ``z`` axis.

microbit.compass.get_z.summary.description: Get the magnetic field strength on the ``z`` axis.

microbit.compass.get_field_strength.description: (function name) Get the magnitude of the magnetic field around the device.

microbit.compass.get_field_strength.summ.description: Get the magnitude of the magnetic field around the device.

microbit.display.description: (module name) Show text, images and animations on the 5×5 LED display.

microbit.display.summary.description: Show text, images and animations on the 5×5 LED display.

microbit.display.get_pixel.description: (function name) Get the brightness of the LED at column ``x`` and row ``y``.

microbit.display.get_pixel.summary.description: Get the brightness of the LED at column ``x`` and row ``y``.

microbit.display.set_pixel.description: (function name) Set the brightness of the LED at column ``x`` and row ``y``.

microbit.display.set_pixel.summary.description: Set the brightness of the LED at column ``x`` and row ``y``.

microbit.display.clear.description: (function name) Set the brightness of all LEDs to 0 (off).

microbit.display.clear.summary.description: Set the brightness of all LEDs to 0 (off).

microbit.display.show.description: (function name) Shows images, letters or digits on the LED display.

microbit.display.show.summary.description: Shows images, letters or digits on the LED display.

microbit.display.show.param-name.clear.description: (parameter name) If ``clear`` is ``True``, the display will be cleared after the sequence has finished.

microbit.display.show.param-name.delay.description: (parameter name) Each letter, digit or image is shown with ``delay`` milliseconds between them.

microbit.display.show.param-name.image.description: (parameter name) A string, number, image or list of images to show.

microbit.display.show.param-name.loop.description: (parameter name) If ``loop`` is ``True``, the animation will repeat forever.

microbit.display.show.param-name.wait.description: (parameter name) If ``wait`` is ``True``, this function will block until the animation is finished, otherwise the animation will happen in the background.

microbit.display.scroll.description: (function name) Scrolls a number or text on the LED display.

microbit.display.scroll.summary.description: Scrolls a number or text on the LED display.

microbit.display.scroll.param-name.delay.description: (parameter name) The ``delay`` parameter controls how fast the text is scrolling.

microbit.display.scroll.param-name.loop.description: (parameter name) If ``loop`` is ``True``, the animation will repeat forever.

microbit.display.scroll.param-name.monos.description: (parameter name) If ``monospace`` is ``True``, the characters will all take up 5 pixel-columns in width, otherwise there will be exactly 1 blank pixel-column between each character as they scroll.

microbit.display.scroll.param-name.text.description: (parameter name) The string to scroll. If ``text`` is an integer or float it is first converted to a string using ``str()``.

microbit.display.scroll.param-name.wait.description: (parameter name) If ``wait`` is ``True``, this function will block until the animation is finished, otherwise the animation will happen in the background.

microbit.display.on.description: (function name) Turn on the LED display.

microbit.display.off.description: (function name) Turn off the LED display (disabling the display allows you to re-use the GPIO pins for other purposes).

microbit.display.off.summary.description: Turn off the LED display (disabling the display allows you to re-use the GPIO pins for other purposes).

microbit.display.is_on.description: (function name) Check whether the LED display is enabled.

microbit.display.is_on.summary.description: Check whether the LED display is enabled.

microbit.i2c.description: (module name) Communicate with devices using the I²C bus protocol.

microbit.i2c.summary.description: Communicate with devices using the I²C bus protocol.

microbit.i2c.scan.description: (function name) Scan the bus for devices.

microbit.i2c.read.description: (function name) Read bytes from a device.

microbit.i2c.read.param-name.addr.description: (parameter name) The 7-bit address of the device

microbit.i2c.read.param-name.n.description: (parameter name) The number of bytes to read

microbit.i2c.read.param-name.repeat.description: (parameter name) If ``True``, no stop bit will be sent

microbit.i2c.write.description: (function name) Write bytes to a device.

microbit.i2c.write.param-name.addr.description: (parameter name) The 7-bit address of the device

microbit.i2c.write.param-name.buf.description: (parameter name) A buffer containing the bytes to write

microbit.i2c.write.param-name.repeat.description: (parameter name) If ``True``, no stop bit will be sent

microbit.microphone.description: (module name) Respond to sound using the built-in microphone (V2 only).

microbit.microphone.summary.description: Respond to sound using the built-in microphone (V2 only).

microbit.microphone.current_event.description: (function name) Get the last recorded sound event

microbit.microphone.current_event.summar.description: Get the last recorded sound event

microbit.microphone.was_event.description: (function name) Check if a sound was heard at least once since the last call.

microbit.microphone.was_event.summary.description: Check if a sound was heard at least once since the last call.

microbit.microphone.was_event.param-name.description: (parameter name) The event to check for,  such as ``SoundEvent.LOUD`` or ``SoundEvent.QUIET``

microbit.microphone.is_event.description: (function name) Check the most recent sound event detected.

microbit.microphone.is_event.summary.description: Check the most recent sound event detected.

microbit.microphone.is_event.param-name..description: (parameter name) The event to check for,  such as ``SoundEvent.LOUD`` or ``SoundEvent.QUIET``

microbit.microphone.get_events.description: (function name) Get the sound event history as a tuple.

microbit.microphone.get_events.summary.description: Get the sound event history as a tuple.

microbit.microphone.set_threshold.description: (function name) Set the threshold for a sound event.

microbit.microphone.set_threshold.summar.description: Set the threshold for a sound event.

microbit.microphone.set_threshold.param-.description: (parameter name) A sound event, such as ``SoundEvent.LOUD`` or ``SoundEvent.QUIET``.
(parameter name) The threshold level in the range 0-255.

microbit.microphone.sound_level.description: (function name) Get the sound pressure level.

microbit.speaker.description: (module name) Control the built-in speaker (V2 only).

microbit.spi.description: (module name) Communicate with devices using the serial peripheral interface (SPI) bus.

microbit.spi.summary.description: Communicate with devices using the serial peripheral interface (SPI) bus.

microbit.spi.init.param-name.bits.description: (parameter name) The width in bits of each transfer. Currently only ``bits=8`` is supported. However, this may change in the future.

microbit.spi.init.param-name.mode.description: (parameter name) Determines the combination of clock polarity and phase - `see online table <https://microbit-micropython.readthedocs.io/en/v2-docs/spi.html#microbit.spi.init>`_.

microbit.spi.read.param-name.nbytes.description: (parameter name) Maximum number of bytes to read.

microbit.spi.write.description: (function name) Write bytes to the bus.

microbit.spi.write.param-name.buffer.description: (parameter name) A buffer to read data from.

microbit.spi.write_readinto.description: (function name) Write the ``out`` buffer to the bus and read any response into the ``in_`` buffer.

microbit.spi.write_readinto.summary.description: Write the ``out`` buffer to the bus and read any response into the ``in_`` buffer.

microbit.spi.write_readinto.param-name.i.description: (parameter name) The buffer to read data from.

microbit.spi.write_readinto.param-name.o.description: (parameter name) The buffer to write any response to.

microbit.uart.description: (module name) Communicate with a device using a serial interface.

microbit.uart.summary.description: Communicate with a device using a serial interface.

microbit.uart.init.param-name.bits.description: (parameter name) The size of bytes being transmitted. micro:bit only supports 8.

microbit.uart.init.param-name.parity.description: (parameter name) How parity is checked, ``None``, ``uart.ODD`` or ``uart.EVEN``.

microbit.uart.init.param-name.stop.description: (parameter name) The number of stop bits, has to be 1 for micro:bit.

microbit.uart.any.description: (function name) Check if any data is waiting.

microbit.uart.any.summary.description: Check if any data is waiting.

microbit.uart.read.param-name.nbytes.description: (parameter name) If ``nbytes`` is specified then read at most that many bytes, otherwise read as many bytes as possible

microbit.uart.readinto.param-name.buf.description: (parameter name) The buffer to write to.

microbit.uart.readinto.param-name.nbytes.description: (parameter name) If ``nbytes`` is specified then read at most that many bytes, otherwise read ``len(buf)`` bytes.

microbit.uart.readline.description: (function name) Read a line, ending in a newline character.

microbit.uart.readline.summary.description: Read a line, ending in a newline character.

microbit.uart.write.description: (function name) Write a buffer to the bus.

microbit.uart.write.summary.description: Write a buffer to the bus.

microbit.uart.write.param-name.buf.description: (parameter name) A bytes object or a string.

micropython.mem_info.param-name.verbose.description: (parameter name) If the ``verbose`` argument is given then extra information is printed.

micropython.qstr_info.param-name.verbose.description: (parameter name) If the ``verbose`` argument is given then extra information is printed.

used.

micropython.stack_use.summary.description:
Return an integer representing the current amount of stack that is being

micropython.kbd_intr.param-name.chr.description: (parameter name) Character code to raise the interrupt or -1 to disable capture of Ctrl-C.

music.DADADADUM.description: (field name) Melody: the opening to Beethoven’s 5th Symphony in C minor.

music.DADADADUM.summary.description: Melody: the opening to Beethoven’s 5th Symphony in C minor.

music.ENTERTAINER.description: (field name) Melody: the opening fragment of Scott Joplin’s Ragtime classic “The Entertainer”.

music.ENTERTAINER.summary.description: Melody: the opening fragment of Scott Joplin’s Ragtime classic “The Entertainer”.

music.PRELUDE.description: (field name) Melody: the opening of the first Prelude in C Major of J.S.Bach’s 48 Preludes and Fugues.

music.PRELUDE.summary.description: Melody: the opening of the first Prelude in C Major of J.S.Bach’s 48 Preludes and Fugues.

music.ODE.description: (field name) Melody: the “Ode to Joy” theme from Beethoven’s 9th Symphony in D minor.

music.ODE.summary.description: Melody: the “Ode to Joy” theme from Beethoven’s 9th Symphony in D minor.

music.NYAN.description: (field name) Melody: the Nyan Cat theme (http://www.nyan.cat/).

music.RINGTONE.description: (field name) Melody: something that sounds like a mobile phone ringtone.

music.RINGTONE.summary.description: Melody: something that sounds like a mobile phone ringtone.

music.FUNK.description: (field name) Melody: a funky bass line for secret agents and criminal masterminds.

music.FUNK.summary.description: Melody: a funky bass line for secret agents and criminal masterminds.

music.BLUES.description: (field name) Melody: a boogie-woogie 12-bar blues walking bass.

music.BLUES.summary.description: Melody: a boogie-woogie 12-bar blues walking bass.

music.WEDDING.description: (field name) Melody: the bridal chorus from Wagner’s opera “Lohengrin”.

music.WEDDING.summary.description: Melody: the bridal chorus from Wagner’s opera “Lohengrin”.

music.FUNERAL.description: (field name) Melody: the “funeral march” otherwise known as Frédéric Chopin’s Piano Sonata No. 2 in B♭ minor, Op. 35.

music.FUNERAL.summary.description: Melody: the “funeral march” otherwise known as Frédéric Chopin’s Piano Sonata No. 2 in B♭ minor, Op. 35.

music.PUNCHLINE.description: (field name) Melody: a fun fragment that signifies a joke has been made.

music.PUNCHLINE.summary.description: Melody: a fun fragment that signifies a joke has been made.

music.PYTHON.description: (field name) Melody: John Philip Sousa’s march “Liberty Bell” aka, the theme for “Monty Python’s Flying Circus” (after which the Python programming language is named).

music.PYTHON.summary.description: Melody: John Philip Sousa’s march “Liberty Bell” aka, the theme for “Monty Python’s Flying Circus” (after which the Python programming language is named).

music.BADDY.description: (field name) Melody: silent movie era entrance of a baddy.

music.BADDY.summary.description: Melody: silent movie era entrance of a baddy.

music.CHASE.description: (field name) Melody: silent movie era chase scene.

music.CHASE.summary.description: Melody: silent movie era chase scene.

music.BA_DING.description: (field name) Melody: a short signal to indicate something has happened.

music.BA_DING.summary.description: Melody: a short signal to indicate something has happened.

music.WAWAWAWAA.description: (field name) Melody: a very sad trombone.

music.JUMP_UP.description: (field name) Melody: for use in a game, indicating upward movement.

music.JUMP_UP.summary.description: Melody: for use in a game, indicating upward movement.

music.JUMP_DOWN.description: (field name) Melody: for use in a game, indicating downward movement.

music.JUMP_DOWN.summary.description: Melody: for use in a game, indicating downward movement.

music.POWER_UP.description: (field name) Melody: a fanfare to indicate an achievement unlocked.

music.POWER_UP.summary.description: Melody: a fanfare to indicate an achievement unlocked.

music.POWER_DOWN.description: (field name) Melody: a sad fanfare to indicate an achievement lost.

music.POWER_DOWN.summary.description: Melody: a sad fanfare to indicate an achievement lost.

music.set_tempo.description: (function name) Sets the approximate tempo for playback.

music.set_tempo.summary.description: Sets the approximate tempo for playback.

music.set_tempo.param-name.bpm.description: (parameter name) An integer determining how many beats per minute.

music.set_tempo.param-name.ticks.description: (parameter name) The number of ticks constituting a beat.

music.get_tempo.description: (function name) Gets the current tempo as a tuple of integers: ``(ticks, bpm)``.

music.get_tempo.summary.description: Gets the current tempo as a tuple of integers: ``(ticks, bpm)``.

music.play.param-name.loop.description: (parameter name) If ``loop`` is set to ``True``, the tune repeats until ``stop`` is called or the blocking call is interrupted.

music.play.param-name.music.description: (parameter name) music specified in `a special notation <https://microbit-micropython.readthedocs.io/en/v2-docs/music.html#musical-notation>`_

music.play.param-name.pin.description: (parameter name) the output pin for use with an external speaker (default ``pin0``), ``None`` for no sound.

music.play.param-name.wait.description: (parameter name) If ``wait`` is set to ``True``, this function is blocking.

music.pitch.param-name.duration.description: (parameter name) A millisecond duration. If negative then sound is continuous until the next call or a call to ``stop``.

music.pitch.param-name.wait.description: (parameter name) If ``wait`` is set to ``True``, this function is blocking.

music.stop.description: (function name) Stops all music playback on the built-in speaker and any pin outputting sound.

music.stop.summary.description: Stops all music playback on the built-in speaker and any pin outputting sound.

music.stop.param-name.pin.description: (parameter name) An optional argument can be provided to specify a pin, e.g. ``music.stop(pin1)``.

music.reset.description: (function name) Resets ticks, bpm, duration and octave to their default values.

music.reset.summary.description: Resets ticks, bpm, duration and octave to their default values.

neopixel.description: (module name) Individually addressable RGB and RGBW LED strips.

neopixel.summary.description: Individually addressable RGB and RGBW LED strips.

neopixel.NeoPixel.__init__.param-name.bp.description: (parameter name) Bytes per pixel. For RGBW neopixel support, pass 4 rather than the default of 3 for RGB and GRB.

neopixel.NeoPixel.__init__.param-name.n.description: (parameter name) The number of neopixels in the strip.

neopixel.NeoPixel.__init__.param-name.pi.description: (parameter name) The pin controlling the neopixel strip.

neopixel.NeoPixel.write.description: (function name) Show the pixels (micro:bit V2 only).

neopixel.NeoPixel.fill.param-name.colour.description: (parameter name) A tuple of the same length as the number of bytes per pixel (bpp).

neopixel.NeoPixel.__len__.summary.description: Get length of this pixel strip.

radio.summary.description: Communicate between micro:bits with the built-in radio.

radio.RATE_2MBIT.description: (field name) Constant used to indicate a throughput of 2 MBit a second.

radio.off.summary.description: Turns off the radio, saving power and memory.

radio.config.param-name.address.description:
(parameter name) (default=0x75626974) an arbitrary name, expressed as a 32-bit address, that's used to filter incoming packets at the hardware level, keeping only those that match the address you set.
The default used by other micro:bit related platforms is the default setting used here.

radio.config.param-name.channel.description:
(parameter name) (default=7) an integer value from 0 to 83 (inclusive) that defines an arbitrary "channel" to which the radio is tuned.
Messages will be sent via this channel and only messages received via this channel will be put onto the incoming message queue. Each step is 1MHz wide, based at 2400MHz.

radio.config.param-name.data_rate.description:
(parameter name) (default=``radio.RATE_1MBIT``) indicates the speed at which data throughput takes place.
Can be one of the following constants defined in the ``radio`` module: ``RATE_250KBIT``, ``RATE_1MBIT`` or ``RATE_2MBIT``.

radio.config.param-name.group.description:
(parameter name) (default=0) an 8-bit value (0-255) used with the ``address`` when filtering messages.
Conceptually, "address" is like a house/office address and "group" is like the person at that address to which you want to send your message.

radio.config.param-name.length.description:
(parameter name) (default=32) defines the maximum length, in bytes, of a message sent via the radio.
It can be up to 251 bytes long (254 - 3 bytes for S0, LENGTH and S1 preamble).

radio.config.param-name.power.description:
(parameter name) (default=6) is an integer value from 0 to 7 (inclusive) to indicate the strength of signal used when broadcasting a message.
The higher the value the stronger the signal, but the more power is consumed by the device. The numbering translates to positions in the following list of dBm (decibel milliwatt) values: -30, -20, -16, -12, -8, -4, 0, 4.

radio.config.param-name.queue.description:
(parameter name) (default=3) specifies the number of messages that can be stored on the incoming message queue.
If there are no spaces left on the queue for incoming messages, then the incoming message is dropped.

radio.reset.description: (function name) Reset the settings to their default values.

radio.reset.summary.description: Reset the settings to their default values.

radio.send_bytes.description: (function name) Sends a message containing bytes.

radio.receive_bytes.description: (function name) Receive the next incoming message on the message queue.

radio.receive_bytes.summary.description: Receive the next incoming message on the message queue.

radio.receive_bytes_into.description: (function name) Copy the next incoming message on the message queue into a buffer.

radio.receive_bytes_into.summary.description: Copy the next incoming message on the message queue into a buffer.

radio.receive_bytes_into.param-name.buff.description: (parameter name) The target buffer. The message is truncated if larger than the buffer.

radio.receive.description: (function name) Works in exactly the same way as ``receive_bytes`` but returns whatever was sent.

radio.receive.summary.description: Works in exactly the same way as ``receive_bytes`` but returns whatever was sent.

radio.receive_full.description: (function name) Returns a tuple containing three values representing the next incoming message on the message queue.

radio.receive_full.summary.description: Returns a tuple containing three values representing the next incoming message on the message queue.

(function name) Choose a randomly selected integer between zero and up to (but not
including) ``stop``.

Choose a randomly selected integer between zero and up to (but not
including) ``stop``.

random.randrange-1.param-name.stop.description: (parameter name) End value for the range (exclusive)

random.randrange-2.param-name.start.description: (parameter name) The start of the range (inclusive)

random.randrange-2.param-name.stop.description: (parameter name) The end of the range (exclusive)

random.choice.description: (function name) Choose a random element from the non-empty sequence ``seq``.

random.random.description: (function name) Generate a random floating point number in the range [0.0, 1.0).

random.random.summary.description: Generate a random floating point number in the range [0.0, 1.0).

random.uniform.description: (function name) Return a random floating point number between ``a`` and ``b`` inclusive.

random.uniform.param-name.a.description: (parameter name) Start value for the range (inclusive)

random.uniform.param-name.b.description: (parameter name) End value for the range (inclusive)

speech.description: (module name) Make the micro:bit talk, sing and make other speech like sounds.

speech.summary.description: Make the micro:bit talk, sing and make other speech like sounds.

speech.translate.description: (function name) Translate English words to phonemes.

speech.translate.param-name.words.description: (parameter name) A string of English words.

speech.pronounce.param-name.mouth.description: (parameter name) A number representing the mouth of the voice

speech.pronounce.param-name.phonemes.description: (parameter name) The string of phonemes to pronounce

speech.pronounce.param-name.pin.description:
(parameter name) Optional argument to specify the output pin can be used to override the default of ``pin0``.
If we do not want any sound to play out of the pins can use ``pin=None``. micro:bit V2 only.

speech.pronounce.param-name.pitch.description: (parameter name) A number representing the pitch of the voice

speech.pronounce.param-name.speed.description: (parameter name) A number representing the speed of the voice

speech.pronounce.param-name.throat.description: (parameter name) A number representing the throat of the voice

speech.say.param-name.pin.description:
(parameter name) Optional argument to specify the output pin can be used to override the default of ``pin0``.
If we do not want any sound to play out of the pins can use ``pin=None``. micro:bit V2 only.

speech.say.param-name.pitch.description: (parameter name) A number representing the pitch of the voice

speech.say.param-name.speed.description: (parameter name) A number representing the speed of the voice

speech.say.param-name.throat.description: (parameter name) A number representing the throat of the voice

speech.say.param-name.words.description: (parameter name) The string of words to say.

speech.sing.param-name.mouth.description: (parameter name) A number representing the mouth of the voice

speech.sing.param-name.phonemes.description: (parameter name) The string of words to sing.

speech.sing.param-name.pin.description:

speech.sing.param-name.pitch.description: (parameter name) A number representing the pitch of the voice

sys.implementation.description: (field name) Object with information about the current Python implementation.

sys.maxsize.description:
(field name) 
Maximum value which a native integer type can hold on the current platform,
or maximum value representable by MicroPython integer type, if it's smaller
than platform max value (that is the case for MicroPython ports without
long int support).

sys.maxsize.summary.description:
Maximum value which a native integer type can hold on the current platform,
or maximum value representable by MicroPython integer type, if it's smaller
than platform max value (that is the case for MicroPython ports without
long int support).

sys.platform.description: (field name) The platform that MicroPython is running on.

time.description: (module name) Measure time and add delays to programs.

time.summary.description: Measure time and add delays to programs.

time.sleep.description: (function name) Delay a number of seconds.

time.sleep.param-name.seconds.description:
(parameter name) The number of seconds to sleep for.
Use a floating-point number to sleep for a fractional number of seconds.

time.sleep_ms.description: (function name) Delay for given number of milliseconds.

time.sleep_ms.summary.description: Delay for given number of milliseconds.

time.sleep_ms.param-name.ms.description: (parameter name) The number of milliseconds delay (>= 0).

time.sleep_us.description: (function name) Delay for given number of microseconds.

time.sleep_us.summary.description: Delay for given number of microseconds.

time.sleep_us.param-name.us.description: (parameter name) The number of microseconds delay (>= 0).

time.ticks_ms.description:
(function name) Get an increasing, millisecond counter with an arbitrary reference point,
that wraps around after some value.

time.ticks_ms.summary.description:
Get an increasing, millisecond counter with an arbitrary reference point,
that wraps around after some value.

time.ticks_us.description:
(function name) Get an increasing, microsecond counter with an arbitrary reference point,
that wraps around after some value.

time.ticks_us.summary.description:
Get an increasing, microsecond counter with an arbitrary reference point,
that wraps around after some value.

time.ticks_add.description:
(function name) Offset ticks value by a given number, which can be either positive or
negative.

time.ticks_add.summary.description:
Offset ticks value by a given number, which can be either positive or
negative.

time.ticks_diff.description:
(function name) Measure ticks difference between values returned from
``time.ticks_ms()`` or ``ticks_us()``, as a signed value
which may wrap around.

time.ticks_diff.summary.description:
Measure ticks difference between values returned from
``time.ticks_ms()`` or ``ticks_us()``, as a signed value
which may wrap around.

time.ticks_diff.param-name.ticks1.description: (parameter name) The value to subtract from
